title: Agwu
author: Agwu
content: Considering rate at which hundreds of cryptocurrencies are flooding the blockhain space it seems digital currency is taking over the fiat. But the question now is how does one get to know the right crypto project to invest in?

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Agwu on August 12, 2022, 10:41:30 AMConsidering rate at which hundreds of cryptocurrencies are flooding the blockhain space it seems digital currency is taking over the fiat. But the question now is how does one get to know the right crypto project to invest in?Bitcoin is the safe bet.And those who fancy higher risk gambling with their funds, there are a lot of altcoins to choose. Some few may get lucky.Conclusion: too hard to choose right if you want something else than Bitcoin. So.. just choose Bitcoin.PS. Not a financial advice, do with your money whatever suits you best.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Depends on your preferences I guess? Of course if you exclude shitcoins or those useless token that appears out of thin air, choosing which crypto to invest in depends on what project you believe in, but mostly, people chose bitcoin as it is the safest option out there especially for newbies.For me as an example, majority of my portfolio is heavily invested in bitcoin because of how briliant the technology it offers, it is also a multifaceted tool that will serve as your gateway down the rabbit hole when it comes to programming, security, privacy and economics(finance). Moreover, less than 10% of my portfolio is in ETH and XMR as I think that ETH could offer a lot of opportunies in Defi/GameFi while Monero is for privacy related stuff.Besides preferences, one important matter is your financial capabilities and your risk tolerance.

comments.body: Quote from: Agwu on August 12, 2022, 10:41:30 AMConsidering rate at which hundreds of cryptocurrencies are flooding the blockhain space it seems digital currency is taking over the fiat. But the question now is how does one get to know the right crypto project to invest in?Maybe bitcoin is the right choice to invest in. Although the price of bitcoin is now wilder than a few years before, you can use bitcoin as a short, medium, and long-term investment. But if you want to choose to invest in altcoins other than bitcoin, it will not be easy because many altcoins will tempt you to buy and serve as investments. Maybe you can do some research on the coins that are on the list of the top 25 coins so you don't have too many choices to invest and you won't be too confused about managing them. ETH and BNB are coins that you can invest in because these two coins have great potential to increase in height but do your research first and don't rush to make a decision.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Check their coin or token distribution.If you see distribution is not fair and centralized in top wallets, there is risk of price dumps from top wallets or worse, rug pull. It is the first thing I would prefer to check. Not Whitepaper because they can lie in White paper but on chain stats can not be faked. We can check block explorer to see the distribution that can not be hidden.My old topic but you can apply it for tokens with smart contracts[Guide] Identify scam projects by hidden premined coin indicator via explorer

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: This has been asked a million times and there isn't really a great one correct answer. I mean everyone would love to answer this but not many people can. The best thing to do would be making sure that it is not a scam. If you can invest into something that is not a scam then you are doing the right thing, if you are investing into something that is just simply failing, that's fine and it happens.Most of the market went down for example, and has been down for a lot of months now, does that mean everyone failed to find good projects? Of course not, but Luna ended up going to zero, which means that someone who had bitcoin and someone who had luna, both different people, they both lost, but one lost way more than the other. Make that difference.
